Class MoveableObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • ghost.GameObject
      • ghost.MoveableObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Ghost, Waka

    public abstract class MoveableObject
extends GameObject

      protected java.util.List<GameObject> walls

      The horizontal speed of the moveable object
      protected int Yspeed
      The vertical speed of the movable object

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkCollision(java.lang.String direction)
      Given a direction, will check whether moving in that direction will result in a collsion or not.
      abstract java.lang.String hasCollided(int x, int y)
      Checks whether the object is currently colliding with any walls and returns the direction of the collision, or "no collision" if there is not collision
      void helper()
      Determines the direction of the current collision and sets the object back one position in the opposite direction so that it is no longer colliding
      void move(java.lang.String direction)
      Takes in a direction and sets the horizonal or vertical velocity accordingly so that the object moves in the given direction
      abstract void reset()
      Resets the the object to its original position

      • reset

        public abstract void reset()
        Resets the the object to its original position

      • checkCollision

        public boolean checkCollision(java.lang.String direction)
        Given a direction, will check whether moving in that direction will result in a collsion or not. If there will be a collision, returns true, otherwise returns false.
        Parameters:
        direction, - the direction being attempted to move in
        Returns:
        whether a movement in that direction will result in a collision

      • helper

        public void helper()
        Determines the direction of the current collision and sets the object back one position in the opposite direction so that it is no longer colliding

      • move

        public void move(java.lang.String direction)
        Takes in a direction and sets the horizonal or vertical velocity accordingly so that the object moves in the given direction
        Parameters:
        direction, - the direction which the object needs to move

      • hasCollided

        public abstract java.lang.String hasCollided(int x,
                                             int y)
        Checks whether the object is currently colliding with any walls and returns the direction of the collision, or "no collision" if there is not collision
        Parameters:
        x, - the horizontal position of the object
        y, - the vertical position of the object
        Returns:
        if colliding: the direction of the collision. Otherwise "no collision"
